page.title: 02The Duncombe's Manor
page.content: The Duncombes Manor has been in the family since the 16th century.The old Manor was next door to the Manor they have now.It was Georgian.The present Manor at that time was a rectory. Sir Phillip Duncombe's father moved the Rector into the present rectory and moved his family into the rectory in 1920.The original Manor was a Queen Anne house.It was then a boys school until 1933.They then had the Manor knocked down when Phillip Duncombe was 10 years old.In 1946 the Manor owned 1300 acres of land.It consisted of Water Eaton and all around there.Now it has been sold off with only 600 acres left.Westfield Farm and Church farm are now the area owned by them. The Lordship will automatically pass down to his son.He doesn't have any servants only a gardener who comes twice a week.Sir Phillip is also the
